page.title: 16HOW FAZAKERLEY HAS CHANGED
page.content: Fazakerley has changed quite a bit in the last 30 years. A{tramline}used to run down Longmoor Lane where there is now a{dual carriageway.}There were pig sties and an apple orchard at what is now the bus terminus. The Haven Road estate was built in about 1963. The{ {Reo}(now a{bingo}hall) was a cinema showing the latest films. Our school (four modern brick buildings) was a wooden building only. The new Hawksmoor Road estate was built where allotments used to be. A travelling fair used to stay for a while on waste ground in Copple House Lane. The new { {Fazakeley General Hospital}used to be the Aintree Fever Hospital - an isolation unit.{Hartley's Village}on Long Lane was built by the Hartley family who owned the Jam Preserving factory, but has now gone. Dawn Jenkins Kerrie Chapman
